pullRequest.title: show number of open Complaints for Exercises in Tutor dashboard
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


Resolve #586
Description

I added the property numberOfOpenComplaints, which is the number of unevaluated complaints for an Exercise. And the property numberOfOpenMoreFeedbackRequests, which is the number of unevaluated more feedback requests. The sum of these values is then displayed in the tutor participation graph in the form of a progress bar. Calculation: the sum of evaluated complaints and feedback requests divided by the sum of total nr of complaints and feedback requests.
In addition, the definition of the "show finished exercises" was modified. Exercises that still have open complaints or feedback requests are not finished exercises even if all submissions were assessed.
Steps for Testing


Navigate to "Course Administration"
Click on "Tutor Course Dashboard" for a course of your selection
a List of unfinished exercises should be displayed with the newly added progress bar (in the tutor participation graph)
Click on the Checkbox "show finished exercises"
exercises that neither have open assessments nor complaints and feedback will be added to the list of displayed exercises
Click on "Exercises Dashboard" the newly added progress bar indicating the evaluation of complaints and feedback progress should be displayed again in the tutor participation graph

Screenshots

commit.message: comment out redundant assert as it is now allowed to show open complaints for tutors
UI adjustments of the tutor-participation-graph and logic adjustments of the show finished exercises filter after discussions with Stephan
merge develop and adjust test cases in ExerciseIntegrationTest

nodes.bodyText:
This method already is too big imo. I also think we should move most of the code here into the CourseService, as logic like this should not be in a resource. Could you please start by just moving your code there? You also have some code duplication here, so you can just use the same method twice with a parameter ComplaintType complaintType.
In fact, I would move the complaint related requests to the complaint service
I agree, we should ignore complaints related to the tutor's assessment and subtract them from the overall number
Same comment as for the CourseResource
I would argue that we can just remove all these inputs from the component since it already has the whole exercise as an input
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -102,6 +102,10 @@ <h2>
                             [tutorParticipation]="exercise.tutorParticipations[0]"
                             [numberOfParticipations]="exercise.numberOfParticipations"
                             [numberOfAssessments]="exercise.numberOfAssessments"
+                            [numberOfComplaints]="exercise.numberOfComplaints"

nodes.bodyText:
Ok, I only saw this now. So we already have this functionality in the stats-for-tutor-dashboard call, but you basically now do the same thing again for the fort-tutor-dashboard call. The question is then if we really need this code in both endpoints, or if one is sufficient. If we need it in both, then we should really refactor the server code into the {Course,Complaints}Services.
Furthermore, I looked into the CourseResource and we don't even populate the numberOfOpenComplaints and numberOfOpenFeedbackRequests fields in this case. We only do this in the stats-for-instructor-dashboard call (at least in the CourseResource. Please have a look at this process again and make it consistent.
Since this is basically the same code as above, we can refactor this into a small subcomponent.

commit.message: add new component: progress-bar to avoid code duplication

nodes.bodyText:
Aren't you two contradicting each other? Alex wants to exclude the complaints of the tutor himself and Hanya wants to include it. Or am I misunderstanding something?
I guess if the tutor should not know if there are any complaints about his assessments (or how many), it makes sense to exclude those.

I think the reason for this is that jhi-tutor-participation-graph is used in a different way in tutor-exercise-dashboard.component.html where those numbers are not taken from the exercise but are retrieved separately from the /api/exercises/{exerciseId}/stats-for-tutor-dashboard endpoint.

+                            [numberOfComplaints]="exercise.numberOfComplaints"
